examgrader.model

Class Exam

  • java.lang.Object
    • examgrader.model.Exam
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class Exam
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    Represents a multiple choice exam given to students. Each Exam has a name, a penalty amount for incorrect answers, and an ExamKey with all the correct answers. Also stores a list of StudentExams, one for each Student who has taken the exam.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Exam(java.lang.String name)
      Create an exam with specified name and default penalty of 0.25

      Creates an exam with specified name and penalty
      Exam(java.lang.String name, ExamKey key)
      Create an exam with specified name and key, with default penalty of 0.25

    • Method Detail

      • getName

        public java.lang.String getName()
        return name of the exam

      • addStudentAnswers

        public void addStudentAnswers(java.util.List<StudentExam> answers)
        Adds a new list of StudentExam answers to the Exam. Checks each StudentExam before adding to make sure they aren't in the list to avoid duplicates.
        Parameters:
        answers - A List of StudentExams to add.

      • getStudentAnswers

        public java.util.List<StudentExam> getStudentAnswers()
        Returns:
        the list of StudentExams, one for each Student who has taken the exam

      • getKey

        public ExamKey getKey()
        Returns:
        the ExamKey with the correct answers to the Exam

      • getPenalty

        public double getPenalty()
        Returns:
        the penalty for each incorrect, non-blank answer.

      • addKey

        public void addKey(ExamKey key)
        Adds a new ExamKey to the Exam
        Parameters:
        key - ExamKey with correct answers to be added

      • removeStudent

        public void removeStudent(Student s)
        Removes all StudentExams belonging to the specified student. Usually called when deleting a student
        Parameters:
        s - Student whose answers need to be deleted

      • length

        public int length()
        Returns the number of questions in the exam. Also represents the maximum score possible.
        Returns:
        the number of questions in the exam, or 0 if no key has been added yet.

      • markAllStudentAnswers

        public void markAllStudentAnswers()
        Calculates and stores mark for all StudentExams

      • markStudentAnswers

        public void markStudentAnswers(java.util.List<StudentExam> newAnswers)
        Calculate and store mark for selected StudentExams. Called when adding new answers to an exiting exam.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Returns a string representing the exam, formatted for output in a JList. Format is %-15s %-10d %-10d for Name, Length, and number of students who have taken the exam.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        formatted string representing the exam.
